medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hypercalcemia began in early childhood, with constant elevation of plasma calcium concentrations observed. Initially, at 2 years of age, the patient was diagnosed with 22q11.2 deletion syndrome, which typically presents with hypoparathyroidism. However, this patient exhibited hypercalcemia alongside inappropriately high PTH levels. Symptoms persisted, and treatment with cinacalcet was initiated at 10 years of age, which normalized calcium levels but led to mild symptoms of hypocalcemia. Symptoms returned after discontinuation of treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 22q11.2 deletion syndrome confirmed at age 2, with associated facial dysmorphism, delayed motor and speech development, and kidney aplasia.
medical_history.family_history: The mutation (c.44G/H11022T) in the AP2S1 gene was absent in the healthy parents and two siblings. No other family medical history was specified.
